what the fubar is the "type" or "identity" of an rcml entry and how do i get an
actual document revision from there, to check its workflow state?

creator: nettings@apache.org
text:
fixed in trunk, please review. what the underworld is "identity"? is that what
mortals call a username? what do i do with it? why is it a magic string?
what does type refer to? org.apache.lenya.cms.rc.[ci|co]?

(In reply to comment #1)
> fixed in trunk, please review. what the underworld is "identity"? is that what
> mortals call a username?

It can be anything. From the POV of the revision controller, it's just a string
containing some information about "who" or "what" did a check-in/check-out.

> what do i do with it?

Add some info to the check-in/out entry about the person/machine/whatever which
issued the operation.

> why is it a magic string?

It's a remnant from the old ages when Lenya used strings for most
parameterization tasks. It would be nice to replace it with an o.a.l.ac.Identity
object.

> what does type refer to? org.apache.lenya.cms.rc.[ci|co]?

org.apache.lenya.cms.rc.RCML.[ci|co]
